translations.english_saheeh: Say, "I seek refuge in the Lord of daybreak
translations.english_hilali_khan: Say: "I seek refuge with (Allâh), the Lord of the daybreak,
translations.english_rwwad: Say, “I seek refuge with the Lord of the daybreak,

translations.english_saheeh: From the evil of that which He created
translations.english_hilali_khan: "From the evil of what He has created,
translations.english_rwwad: from the harm of all what He has created;

translations.english_saheeh: And from the evil of darkness when it settles
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And from the evil of the darkening (night) as it comes with its darkness; (or the moon as it sets or goes away),
translations.english_rwwad: from the harm of night’s darkness when it spreads around,

phonetic: 113.4 Wa Min Sharri An-Naffāthāti Fī Al-`Uqadi

translations.english_saheeh: And from the evil of the blowers in knots[2014]
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And from the evil of those who practise witchcraft when they blow in the knots,
translations.english_rwwad: from the harm of the sorceresses who blow on knots,

translations.english_saheeh: And from the evil of an envier when he envies."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And from the evil of the envier when he envies."
translations.english_rwwad: and from the harm of the envier when he envies.
